page.title: 17ARLEY COLLIERY 1904-1968
page.content: Opened 1904,the colliery was situated in an easily mined site in the upper coal measures of the East Warks. plateau. Later superceded by Dawmill locally it gave rise to the village of New Arley as it is today. The houses were built on the hillside with the pithead in the valley below. At its height in 1939-1960 over 1000 men were employed. At around this time other collieries were developing and mining became the source of work an influence on the culture of the area. In 1968 the pit was closed which caused some hardship in the area although transfers to other pits could be made. In 1980 an industrial estate was opened on the site of the colliery to encourage jobs. In 1982 1 in 6 of the labour force were unemployed.
